name: ghoulishly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in an ugly and unpleasant or frightening way: She laughed ghoulishly. The wind began to moan ghoulishly.
disapproving in a way that is connected with death and unpleasant events, especially with getting pleasure from hearing or talking about these: He ghoulishly delighted the audience with an account of his crimes. They ghoulishly demanded to know every detail of the murders. See
ghoulish
More examplesFewer examplesA face peered ghoulishly through the windows.The Hungry Ghost Festival shares a ghoulishly festive tone with Mardi Gras and Halloween.She gave an interview which claimed, rather ghoulishly, that it would be her last.
